title: Jungling and Smites (/Dev inspired)
body:
So this first part is quoted from here.

http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2016/12/dev-on-smite-rewards/

>First, let’s start with the goals we have for the jungle:
All classes and positions should have interesting problems to solve in the early game.
When the only choice for a jungler is “Where can I gank?” the result is a small pool of junglers and a very repetitive experience for the jungler and laners.
The early game Jungle is healthiest when players must balance the strengths and weaknesses of their champion against the challenges of the jungle in order to exert pressure on lanes.

Now lets analyze how this is just stupid.

1. Interesting problems to solve in the early game.

The interesting problem being what order do you want to do the 5 available camps, because no jungler does the Raptors for the first clear, and hell most times Krugs are skipped for the first round so it's 4 most times.

The only problem to solve is what to do if your a farming jungler, and that is to change junglers.

2. "Where can i Gank?"

The issue here is that is CAUSED by the changes.

If you have ever played any of the farm heavy junglers (Or just played Ivern) you will know the camp respawns are terrible for anyone who's question ISN'T where can i gank?

3. When early game jungle is healthiest.

Early game jungle was healthiest when most junglers had a choice on their pathing through jungle.

Now though you are put down to about 2-3 pathes that you can complete, and there is nearly always going to be an optimal path which doesn't involve doing Raptors OR Krugs.

Hell this season's jungle is the first time that starting Red buff on Blue team is actually disadvantageous to basically any jungler that does want to farm, not because they don't want red, but because they can't realistically do Raptors level 2, and backtracking to take Krugs is wasting time, meaning the optimal path is Blue > (Gromp, which is less of a backtrack) > Wolves > Red > Krugs(/Raptors if your like one of the 3 that can do Raptors at 3)

This seasons early game jungle is the most monotonous samey shit that i have experienced, and riot making a dev diary saying that they wanted to make it less solved is terrible.

Smite buffs were fine, and your justification for removing them was bad since you said it in the preseason.

Changing it to just here's a heal on smite was basically you guys saying "We know the jungle is too strong without giving smite something to help junglers, but we want to get rid of the one thing that differentiated the camps outside of how much a camp will kick the shit through you (CoughRaptorsCough)."

It's going to be very interesting to see what pro players do in the first weeks of LCS etc. And also what jungle champions are being banned/used. I feel that the jungle has been way too simplified to allow for depth. And the plants changed the way people can gank. There's certain blast cones that are used in the same way all of the time...e.g. blue side jungler ganking top uses it to get in the bush. Slight advantage to blue side now that lane swaps are nerfed. Also the scrying bloom plant is really only used to deny defensive vision around objectives. No sensible jungler uses it **_before_** ganking. So it's largely untouched until objectives like baron are on the table - slight advantage to red side on this one. At least they removed the cheesy Krugs-to level 3-to gank plays. I'd still say that last year's jungle was more interesting and had more depth. They'll probably change it at the end of the season like they seem to always do anyways, so jungle comfort is only a season long experience.
what you said about junglers using it before ganking, yeah, thats so true, cuz they can see the plant going off
